t: Proverbs 3
Wisdom Bestows Well-Being
My*pn son, do not forget my teaching, but*ld keep my commands in your heart,
for*ln they will prolong your life many years and*ld bring you peace and prosperity.
Let*pn love and faithfulness never leave you; bind*ld them around your neck, write*ld them on the tablet of your heart.
Then*ln you will win favor and a good name in*ld the sight of God and man.
Trust*pn in the Lord*s with all your heart and*ld lean not on your own understanding;
in*ln all your ways submit to him, and*ld he will make your paths straight.
Do*pn not be wise in your own eyes; fear*ld the Lord*s and shun evil.
This*ln will bring health to your body and*ld nourishment to your bones.
Honor*pn the Lord*s with your wealth, with*ld the firstfruits of all your crops;
then*ln your barns will be filled to overflowing, and*ld your vats will brim over with new wine.
My*pn son, do not despise the Lord’s*s discipline, and*ld do not resent his rebuke,
because*ln the Lord*s disciplines those he loves, as*ld a father the son he delights in.
Blessed*pn are those who find wisdom, those*ld who gain understanding,
for*ln she is more profitable than silver and*ld yields better returns than gold.
She*ln is more precious than rubies; nothing*ld you desire can compare with her.
Long*ln life is in her right hand; in*ld her left hand are riches and honor.
Her*ln ways are pleasant ways, and*ld all her paths are peace.
She*ln is a tree of life to those who take hold of her; those*ld who hold her fast will be blessed.
By*pn wisdom the Lord*s laid the earth’s foundations, by*ld understanding he set the heavens in place;
by*ln his knowledge the watery depths were divided, and*ld the clouds let drop the dew.
My*pn son, do not let wisdom and understanding out of your sight, preserve*ld sound judgment and discretion;
they*ln will be life for you, an*ld ornament to grace your neck.
Then*ln you will go on your way in safety, and*ld your foot will not stumble.
When*ln you lie down, you will not be afraid; when*ld you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
Have*ln no fear of sudden disaster or*ld of the ruin that overtakes the wicked,
for*ln the Lord*s will be at your side and*ld will keep your foot from being snared.
Do*pn not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when*ld it is in your power to act.
Do*ln not say to your neighbor, “Come*ld back tomorrow and I’ll give it to you”— when*ld you already have it with you.
Do*ln not plot harm against your neighbor, who*ld lives trustfully near you.
Do*ln not accuse anyone for no reason— when*ld they have done you no harm.
Do*pn not envy the violent or*ld choose any of their ways.
For*pn the Lord*s detests the perverse but*ld takes the upright into his confidence.
The*ln Lord’s*s curse is on the house of the wicked, but*ld he blesses the home of the righteous.
He*ln mocks proud mockers but*ld shows favor to the humble and oppressed.
The*ln wise inherit honor, but*ld fools get only shame.
